feed.title: Astrobiology AI Digest - All
feed.subtitle: Hourly AI-curated papers on Origins of Life

entry.title: üü§ The Atlantic ‚û§ 31 Atlantic Stories You Might Have Missed
entry.summary: This is a curated list of general-interest Atlantic stories with no content relevant to origins of life, astrobiology, habitability, biosignatures, or related prebiotic chemistry.

entry.title: üü§ The New York Times ‚û§ Book Review: ‚ÄòSaving Time,‚Äô by Jenny Odell
entry.summary: A general-interest book review about rethinking human conceptions of time to motivate hope and action, with no connection to astrobiology or origins-of-life research.

entry.title: üü§ The Inquisitive Biologist ‚û§ Book review ‚Äì The Desert Bones: The Paleontology and Paleoecology of Mid-Cretaceous North Africa
entry.summary: A book review summarizing Mid-Cretaceous North African paleontology and paleoecology, with no direct connection to origins-of-life, prebiotic chemistry, habitability, or astrobiology.

entry.title: üü° biophysics ‚û§ Structural basis for hydrolytic splicing of a circularly permuted group II intron
entry.summary: High-resolution cryo-EM and biochemistry reveal how a circularly permuted group II intron switches from branching to hydrolysis via active-site rearrangements, illuminating ribozyme catalysis and RNA-based evolutionary mechanisms relevant to RNA-world discussions.

entry.title: üü† eLife ‚û§ Evolution of a fuzzy ribonucleoprotein complex in viral assembly
entry.summary: Using SARS‚ÄëCoV‚Äë2 nucleocapsid variants, the study shows convergent evolution toward stronger, distributed weak N‚ÄìRNA/protein interfaces that tune assembly of pleomorphic (‚Äúfuzzy‚Äù) ribonucleoprotein condensates, offering general insight into how simple RNA‚Äìprotein self-assembly can be optimized by evolution.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ University Of Canterbury Team Led Study Of Interstellar Comet 3I/ATLAS
entry.summary: Observational/physical characterization of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS provides broad astrobiology context (e.g., potential constraints on cometary volatile/organic inventories) but is not directly focused on prebiotic chemistry or origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ Redox Diversity of Interstellar Compounds and Human Nutrients Reveals a Potentially Universal Chemical Constraint for Life
entry.summary: A comparative redox analysis finds interstellar molecules and human nutrients share a similarly non-random balance of oxidants, reductants, and amphoterics, suggesting a potentially universal chemical constraint relevant to the emergence of metabolism and life.

entry.title: üü° Astrobiology ‚û§ LIFE NASA RCN Seminar 6 January 2026
entry.summary: Seminar announcement highlighting work on deconvolving ancient biomarker signals to reconstruct primary ecosystem composition and clarify early eukaryotic evolution.

entry.title: üî¥ New Scientist ‚û§ The cassette tape made a comeback in 2025 thanks to a DNA upgrade
entry.summary: A popular-science report on using DNA as an ultra-dense medium for cassette-tape-style data storage, tangentially relevant to origins-of-life only through its use of nucleic acids.

entry.title: üü¢ bioRxiv Subject Collection ‚û§ Characterization of Z-DNA dynamics across the tree of life
entry.summary: Large-scale comparative genomics across 281k genomes shows pervasive enrichment of Z-DNA in cellular life but striking lineage-specific depletion of Z-RNA-forming motifs in influenza viruses, implying strong evolutionary constraints on alternative nucleic acid conformations.

entry.title: üî¥ ScienceDaily ‚û§ Earth‚Äôs worst extinction was followed by a shockingly fast ocean comeback
entry.summary: A Science report on rapid marine ecosystem recovery just ~3 million years after the end-Permian mass extinction, offering broad astrobiology-relevant context on biosphere resilience but not directly addressing origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üü§ Entropy ‚û§ Entropy, Vol. 28, Pages 47: Optimizing ATP Isothermal Tests: A Theoretical and Experimental Approach
entry.summary: Develops and validates a heat-transfer model to drastically shorten standardized isothermal testing of refrigerated containers while improving uncertainty in the global heat-transfer coefficient, with only incidental relevance to astrobiology via mention of water evaporation.

entry.title: üü§ bioinformatics ‚û§ Multimodal AI for Single cfDNA Profiling and Cancer Screening
entry.summary: Develops a Transformer-based multimodal AI method to profile single-molecule cfDNA (methylation, fragmentomics, histone marks) for improved cancer screening, with minimal relevance to origins-of-life beyond general DNA-related methodology.

entry.title: üî¥ bioRxiv Subject Collection ‚û§ Selection against dispersers: Sex, age and origin-dependent fitness differences in wild Atlantic salmon
entry.summary: Using a 15-year genetic pedigree of Atlantic salmon, the study shows immigrant reproductive success is generally lower than locals but varies strongly with population of origin, sex, and life-history, highlighting heterogeneous dispersal costs in local adaptation.

entry.title: üü§ Radio-Canada ‚û§ Les recherches reprennent pour retrouver le vol MH370, 11 ans apr√®s sa disparition
entry.summary: News update on renewed search efforts for the missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, with no connection to astrobiology or origins-of-life research.

entry.title: üî¥ Phys.org ‚û§ Clouds are vital to life‚Äîbut many are becoming wispy ghosts. Here's how to see the changes above us
entry.summary: A reflective, non-academic discussion of how changing cloud properties affect Earth‚Äôs climate regulation, offering only indirect, broad-context relevance to planetary habitability and astrobiology.

entry.title: üü§ bioinformatics ‚û§ Generative Reconstruction of Unobserved Cellular Dynamics using Single-Cell Transcriptomic Trajectories
entry.summary: Presents a machine-learning framework (GRAIL) to generate plausible intermediate single-cell transcriptomic states between observed developmental stages, with minimal direct relevance to origins-of-life or astrobiology.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ LIFE NASA RCN Seminar 6 January 2026
entry.summary: Seminar announcement highlighting work on deconvolving ancient biomarker signals to infer early ecosystem composition and eukaryotic evolution, offering indirect context rather than direct origins-of-life research.

entry.title: üî¥ New Scientist ‚û§ Star that seemed to vanish more than 130 years ago is found again
entry.summary: A historical astronomy re-analysis explains Barnard‚Äôs 1892 ‚Äúvanishing star‚Äù sighting near Venus, with minimal direct relevance to origins-of-life or habitability research beyond contextual Venus proximity.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ University Of Canterbury Team Led Study Of Interstellar Comet 3I/ATLAS
entry.summary: Observational and dynamical characterization of the rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS, a potential (but not explicitly addressed here) context source for exogenous delivery of prebiotic materials rather than a direct origins-of-life study.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ Redox Diversity of Interstellar Compounds and Human Nutrients Reveals a Potentially Universal Chemical Constraint for Life
entry.summary: Compares redox-class distributions of interstellar molecules and human nutrients against broad chemical space (PubChem), suggesting a potentially universal redox balance constraint relevant to prebiotic chemistry and origins-of-life plausibility.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ HKUST Launches World‚Äôs First Deep-sea Multi-omics Resource Platform Empowering Global Research Into Biological Adaptation In Extreme Environments
entry.summary: Introduces a deep-ocean multi-omics database resource that supports astrobiology by enabling comparative studies of molecular adaptation in extreme, potentially life-analog environments, but it is not a direct origins-of-life mechanistic study.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Performance Calibration of the Wavefront Sensor‚Äôs EMCCD Detector for the Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph Aboard CSST
entry.summary: Characterizes and calibrates an EMCCD detector for the CSST Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph wavefront sensor, improving high-contrast exoplanet imaging capability (instrumentation relevant but not directly about habitability or origins of life).

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Fungi From Chernobyl: Mycobiota Of The Inner Regions Of The Containment Structures Of The Damaged Nuclear Reactor
entry.summary: Survey of 37 fungal species colonizing the highly radioactive interior of the Chernobyl reactor containment, informing extremophile resilience and potential habitability in radiation-rich environments but not directly addressing origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Observational Evidence For A Possible Link Between PAH Emission And Dust Trap Locations In Protoplanetary Disks
entry.summary: Compares PAH emission strengths across protoplanetary disks with ALMA dust-trap locations, suggesting a possible connection between PAH distribution/freeze-out and dust concentration that could affect the organic carbon inventory delivered to forming planetesimals.

entry.title: üü§ Radio-Canada ‚û§ L‚ÄôARC tente de recouvrer 10 G $ de prestations li√©es √† la COVID-19
entry.summary: French news item about the Canada Revenue Agency attempting to recover COVID-19 benefit payments made to ineligible recipients, with no relevance to origins-of-life or astrobiology.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Understanding Protein Form And Function Better At TU Graz
entry.summary: Reports a TU Graz study (Cell/Structure) improving understanding of protein 3D form‚Äìfunction relationships, broadly relevant to biochemistry but only indirectly to origins-of-life questions.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Considerations On The Process Of Target Selection For The Comet Interceptor Mission
entry.summary: Reviews how ESA‚Äôs Comet Interceptor will choose an as-yet-unknown long-period comet target, a mission-planning topic with indirect astrobiology relevance because pristine comets can constrain delivery of water and organics important for origins-of-life scenarios.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ Curiosity Mars Rover Views A Rock Made Of Sulfur At Snow Lake
entry.summary: Curiosity imaged and analyzed a sulfur-bearing rock at ‚ÄúSnow Lake,‚Äù highlighting unusual Martian sulfur mineralogy with potential astrobiological context but limited direct relevance to origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ Viking Mars, Now 50 Years Old, Still Needs a Scientific Analysis
entry.summary: Commentary on the Viking Mars mission‚Äôs legacy and the need for renewed scientific analysis, relevant to astrobiology and Mars life-detection context but not a direct origins-of-life study.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ University Of Canterbury Team Led Study Of Interstellar Comet 3I/ATLAS
entry.summary: Observational/characterization work on the rare interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS provides broad astrobiology context (e.g., potential inventory of extraterrestrial volatiles/organics) but is not directly focused on prebiotic chemistry or origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ LIFE NASA RCN Seminar 6 January 2026
entry.summary: Seminar announcement highlighting work on deconvolving ancient biomarker signals to infer early ecosystem composition and eukaryotic evolution, relevant to astrobiology but not a primary origins-of-life research paper.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ HKUST Launches World‚Äôs First Deep-sea Multi-omics Resource Platform Empowering Global Research Into Biological Adaptation In Extreme Environments
entry.summary: Announces the Deep Ocean Omics (DOO) database integrating deep-sea multi-omics datasets to study biological adaptation in extreme environments, providing useful astrobiology analog resources but not directly addressing origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Performance Calibration of the Wavefront Sensor‚Äôs EMCCD Detector for the Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph Aboard CSST
entry.summary: This paper reports calibration and performance characterization of an EMCCD detector for the CSST Cool Planets Imaging Coronagraph wavefront sensor, improving high-contrast exoplanet imaging capability but not directly addressing origins-of-life or biosignature/habitability science.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Fungi From Chernobyl: Mycobiota Of The Inner Regions Of The Containment Structures Of The Damaged Nuclear Reactor
entry.summary: Survey of diverse fungi colonizing highly radioactive interior structures at Chernobyl, relevant to astrobiology via radiation-tolerant eukaryotic survival and implications for habitat limits but not directly focused on origins-of-life mechanisms.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Redox Diversity of Interstellar Compounds and Human Nutrients Reveals a Potentially Universal Chemical Constraint for Life
entry.summary: Compares redox-class distributions of interstellar molecules and human nutrients against PubChem chemical space, suggesting a potentially universal redox-balance constraint that could shape prebiotic chemistry and life‚Äôs chemical selection.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Observational Evidence For A Possible Link Between PAH Emission And Dust Trap Locations In Protoplanetary Disks
entry.summary: Compares PAH emission strengths to ALMA dust-trap structures in protoplanetary disks, suggesting a possible connection between organic molecules and dust concentration sites that could influence the inventory of organics incorporated into planet-forming material.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Understanding Protein Form And Function Better At TU Graz
entry.summary: A Cell Press Structure-linked report on improved methods to determine protein 3D form‚Äìfunction relationships, broadly relevant to biology but only indirectly connected to origins-of-life questions.

entry.title: üî¥ Astrobiology ‚û§ Considerations On The Process Of Target Selection For The Comet Interceptor Mission
entry.summary: Discusses how ESA‚Äôs Comet Interceptor will select a yet-unknown comet target, a mission-planning topic with indirect relevance to origins-of-life via cometary delivery of volatiles and organics but little direct prebiotic/abiogenesis content.

entry.title: üü† Astrobiology ‚û§ Curiosity Mars Rover Views A Rock Made Of Sulfur At Snow Lake
entry.summary: Curiosity imaged and analyzed a sulfur-bearing rock at ‚ÄúSnow Lake,‚Äù highlighting Mars geochemistry (elemental sulfur and crystalline textures) that can inform past habitability but is not directly focused on origins-of-life mechanisms.
